intro: Planchonella sebertii, commonly known as the Queensland nut, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of northern Australia and parts of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a unique fruit with a hard, woody shell that encases a single, oily seed. The oil extracted from the seed is used in both culinary and industrial applications. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland rainforest habitats.
